main event: A Holloman Air Force Base observer saw a bright, starlike object that changed color from white to green and red, hovering and moving erratically above the horizon on January 13, 1950.
interesting points: The object was observed at 0605 hours and again a week later when daylight arrived, suggesting it was likely the planet Venus.
The object was described as brilliant white, changing to red and green, and hovering above the horizon.
The observer was unable to determine the size, distance, or altitude of the object due to its unknown size.
No exhaust or propulsion system was observed, and the object's movements were described as erratic and poor in control and stability.
Similar sightings by other observers at Holloman AFB were reported and investigated, but the object could not be definitively identified.
sighted object: a bright, starlike object that changed color from white to green and red
location: Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico
witnesses: Pfc. John M. Gusich, 3024th Air Police Squadron
